lines.text: Fingers curl from v to B through smaller angle

secText:
Lesson:
1. Describe the components of a [OBJ:expsec_q754:magnet].
2. Define [OBJ:expsec_q755:magnetic fields].
3. Describe the magnetic field around [OBJ:expsec_q757:Earth].
4. Apply the concept of magnetic fields to [OBJ:expsec_q758:compasses].
5. [OBJ:actsec_jrb1:Experiment] with charged particles in magnetic fields.
6. Determine the direction of the [OBJ:expsec_q759:force] that a magnetic field applies on a moving charge using diagrams.
7. Determine the direction of the force that a magnetic field applies on a moving charge using the [OBJ:expsec_q760:right-hand rule].
8. [OBJ:expsec_q761:Calculate] the force that a magnetic field applies on a moving charge. Calculate the strength of a magnetic field using force, velocity, and charge.
9. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_force_on_e_in_B_question:calculate the direction of the force] acting on a moving charge in a magnetic field.

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37466:Calculate] the force of a magnetic field on a moving charge.
